author: Andrei Markeev

changelog.release_notes:
- Added auto refresh
- Fixed bug when settings weren't saved in some cases

- Improvements for watch-phone communication for processing utf-8 texts
- Settings page should now correctly display the current settings
- Fixed problem with timezone on Aplite

- UI part rewritten in C
- User interface improved
- Now stores events on Pebble itself thus can work even without phone connection
- Much more efficient on resources and battery

- Fixed bug with '\n'
- Added first run message

description:
The app retrieves Office 365 Outlook events and displays them as a list, which you can then browse and see details of each event. Events are cached so they can also be browsed offline (even when Pebble is not connected to phone). Sync interval can be configured so that app checks for new/updated events periodically.

The app will issue reminders 15 minutes prior to events (if you enable this in app settings).

Additionally, if you're late to a meeting, you can reply with an "I'm being late" message. In this case you can select approximate delay (5, 10, 15, 20 or 30 minutes) and send the message.

The message is configurable via app settings.

Notice: Only Office 365 Outlook events are supported, but not Live calendar events.

No companion app is required. The app is opensource, source code available on github.

P.S. This app was NOT developed by Microsoft and is not affiliated with Microsoft. Office 365 is trademark and Outlook is registered trademark of Microsoft Corporation.

latest_release.release_notes:
- Added auto refresh
- Fixed bug when settings weren't saved in some cases

title: Events 365
